_exec_summary.SummaryText:
explosive chemicals codified under the Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations (29 CFR 1910.119) as a best practice. The required elements of the PSM prevention program are listed below: 



     Employee Participation

     Process Safety Information

     Process Hazard Analysis

     Operating Procedures

     Training

     Contractors

     Pre-startup Safety Review

     Mechanical Integrity

     Hot Work Permit

     Management of Change

     Incident Investigation

     Emergency Planning and Response

     Compliance Audits



These items, their specific requirements, and how the Endeavor facility complies with the requirements are addressed in the Risk Management Program & Process Safety Management Program Manual.



The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

The Endeavor facility has had one (1) RMP reportable incident in the previous five years.  The details of this incident have been summarized in Section 6 of the Risk Management Plan as well in the Risk Management Program & Process Safety Management Program Manual.



The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

In the event of an emergency, facility employees will notify the local emergency responders identified in the Emergency Action Plan to respond and will evacuate when needed.  Additional details related to emergency procedures can be located in the facility's Emergency Action Plan that is included in Section 4 of the Risk Management Program & Process Safety Management Program Manual.



Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

The facility completed a process hazard analysis in July 2017 which identified several recommendations for enhanced process safety. These recommendations are summarized in the PHA report and are currently under evaluation.
